intro.speaker: Raimi
intro.line: Prince Chrom, please wait here while I summon the khan.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: The khan is away?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Out training, I'd wager. The khans of Ferox prefer battle to politics. Or rather, battle IS their politics.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: A warrior ruler, eh? I can picture him now… A giant of a man of unparalleled thew, his broad chest covered in hair, heheh…

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Am I now? ...Please, do go on!

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Huh?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: You're the—?! Er, that is to say... The khan, I presume?

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: One of them, yes—the East-Khan. My name is Flavia. I apologize for the troubles at the border, Prince Chrom. You are welcome in Regna Ferox.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Thank you, but I'm confident we can put that misunderstanding behind us. Is it true bandits posing as Ylisseans have been ransacking your border villages?

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Yes. Those Plegian dogs! We found documents proving as much on the corpse of one of their captains. Plegia must see some benefit in raising tensions between your kingdom and ours.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Damn them! I... Forgive me, Your Grace. That was...indelicately put.

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Ha! Damn them and damn delicacy! Here in Ferox, we appreciate plain speech.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: In that case, you should have a word with your damn border guards…

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: ...Ha ha! Now that's Feroxi diplomacy! Yes, I like you already. I know why you have come, Prince. But regrettably, I cannot provide any Feroxi troops for Ylisse.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: What?! Why not?!

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: I lack the authority.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Forgive me, but I don't understand. Aren't you the khan?

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: As I said, I am ONE of the khans. In Ferox, the khans of east and west hold a tournament every few years. The victor acquires total sovereignty over both kingdoms. And that means they have the final say when it comes to forging alliances. The West-Khan won the last tournament, you see, and so…

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: So we are to receive no aid at all?

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Not if you always give up so easily! The next tournament is nigh, you see, and I am in need of champions.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: What does that have to do with us?

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: The captain of my border guard informs me your Shepherds are quite capable. Perhaps you would consider representing the East in the upcoming tournament? If you win and I become ruling khan, I will grant your alliance.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I would have assumed Ylisseans had no place in such Feroxi traditions.

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Ha! On the contrary. The khans themselves do not fight—they choose champions to represent them. Otherwise our land would be rife with blood feuds and dead khans! We don't involve comrades or kin for the same reason. Over time, it was decided the tournament should be fought by outsiders. Although the outsiders have never included foreign royalty. ...That I know of! Ha! Regardless, it is your choice to make.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: There is no choice, East-Khan. My people are desperate. We face not only Plegia's constant attacks, but now the added threat of the Risen. If fighting for you is the quickest way to an alliance, then we will take up our steel.

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Ha ha! Oh, I like you, Prince Chrom. I do hope you survive the tournament! Come, I'll show you the arena where the tournament is held. But be wary! I hear an equally able swordsman champions the West-Khan.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: He shall be defeated by Ylisse’s necessity.

intro.speaker: Flavia
intro.line: Well spoken again—I look forward to seeing if you're equally skilled with a blade!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Marth! One question, before we begin?

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: ...Fine, then. Our swords can speak for us!

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: Where did you get that? There's no way...

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: Tell me—Who taught you to fight like that?

recruit-battle.speaker: Marth
recruit-battle.line: Let us fight with honor. May the best soldier win!

recruit-battle.speaker: Marth
recruit-battle.line: I've said enough for one day, sir.

recruit-battle.speaker: Chrom
recruit-battle.line: Hmph. Is that how it is? Lissa owes you her life, and for that you have my gratitude. But within these walls, I represent the East-Khan and the interests of Ylisse. I can't promise to stay my blade, but I vow not to shame you.

recruit-battle.speaker: Marth
recruit-battle.line: Heh, never expected such youthful arrogance... We shall see who shames who!

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: Well fought! You have my respect. And, perhaps more to the point, you have your alliance. I will provide Ylisse with the soldiers she needs.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Truly? Thank you, East-Khan.

end.speaker: Flavia
end.line: I should thank you! It feels like ages since I've held full power. Come, my new friends! Tonight, we celebrate!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Bah! Any excuse for a party and Flavia jumps on it…

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: I'm sorry, have we met?

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: I'm the West-Khan you so rudely removed from power! You're handy with a sword, boy. I thought for sure I'd picked the stronger man.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: What do you know about him?

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: You mean that "Marth"? Bah! He's just some sellsword with delusions of grandeur. All I know is that he turned up one eve and knocked my old champion flat. It was love at first sight, and I'm generally too old for such things! Baha! Anyway, he's gone now. Up and fled the moment the tournament ended.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: He's so dark and mysterious... *siiigh*

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Sounds like Marth's got at least one fan…

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Well, I mean, c'mon... He IS sort of dreamy, isn't he?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: And YOU'RE sort of dreaming!

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Yowch! Lighten up, Big Brother. I was just kidding.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Milord? Milady? If this fascinating discussion is over, we'd best return home. The exalt will want this news of our new alliance immediately.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Right as always Frederick.

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Hold, boy. Before you go, I have a little present for you.

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: This is Lon'qu, my former champion. Not much for talking, mind you, but he's peerless with a sword. As good as Marth, in my mind. To be honest, I can't figure out how Marth bested him so quickly.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Marth beat him? But he looks so big and strong…

end.speaker: Lon'Qu
end.line: Away, woman!

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Hey! Wh-what did I say?!

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Ba ha ha! Let's just say that ladies tend to put Lon'qu on edge. Nonetheless, he is capable. Perhaps he even has the makings of a khan. Consider him West Ferox's contribution to the Ylissean cause.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You're certain about this?

end.speaker: Basilio
end.line: Yes, yes. He's your man now.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: And Lon'qu? You have no objections?

end.speaker: Lon'Qu
end.line: He gives orders. I stab people. I think our roles are clear.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: ...All right then. Welcome aboard.

dialogue.speaker: Emmeryn
dialogue.line: ...Then Regna Ferox will support Ylisse? Thank you, Chrom. I knew sending you was the right choice.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: You should see Ferox's warriors! Perhaps now our people will be safe from--

dialogue.speaker: Phila
dialogue.line: Your Grace! M-milord! Forgive me, but I bring alarming news!

dialogue.speaker: Emmeryn
dialogue.line: Phila! Slow down, please! What's happened?

dialogue.speaker: Phila
dialogue.line: Plegian soldiers have been sighted inside our southwest border! They attacked a village in Themis and abducted the Duke's daughter.

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: B-but that would be...Maribelle! Chrom, we have to do something!

dialogue.speaker: Phila
dialogue.line: There's more: King Gangrel of Plegia claims Lady Maribelle invaded HIS country. He demands we repay reparations for this "insult."

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: And we're to believe a dastard like the Mad King of Plegia?

dialogue.speaker: Emmeryn
dialogue.line: Peace, Chrom. We must keep our wits about us.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: We should put a sword in his gut and be done with it! The Mad King has been trying to provoke war with Ylisse at every step! He won't stop until he drags this whole continent to hell with him!

dialogue.speaker: Phila
dialogue.line: I agree with the prince, Your Grace. We must demonstrate to Plegia that such actions have consequences.

dialogue.speaker: Emmeryn
dialogue.line: I understand your feelings, Chrom. Truly I do. But if we give him the war he wants, then we lose, no matter what the outcome. Our last conflict nearly ruined the halidom. It left Ylisseans homeless and starving. We cannot repeat that mistake. I will offer parley with King Gangrel.

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: Emm, no! You can't!

dialogue.speaker: Phila
dialogue.line: Please reconsider, Your Grace. He cannot be trusted to act in good faith!

dialogue.speaker: Emmeryn
dialogue.line: So we either choose to march to war or leave Lady Maribelle to die? No. I will not accept that.

dialogue.speaker: Phila
dialogue.line: ...Forgive me, Your Grace. I spoke out of turn. I know you will stand always by your own principles. Pray, allow the pegasus knights to accompany you, though.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: I'm going, too. ...Someone has to save you from your good intentions.

dialogue.speaker: Lissa
dialogue.line: And I want to be there for you AND Maribelle!

dialogue.speaker: Emmeryn
dialogue.line: As you wish. Thank you all. Your strength will be mine.

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: Well then! Is everyone ready to go? It's a long march through the western mountains to the Plegian border.

dialogue.speaker: Ricken
dialogue.line: Captain! I'm all packed! When do we leave?!

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: Ricken? How did you... Go back inside. You're not old enough for this mission.

dialogue.speaker: Ricken
dialogue.line: But, Captain! You know my skill with magic! You know I can handle myself!

dialogue.speaker: Chrom
dialogue.line: I'd feel safer with your magic here, protecting the garrison. All right? We're off, then. Be good.

dialogue.speaker: Ricken
dialogue.line: "Be good"? Gods, how old does he think I am? ...Well, I'll show him just how good I can be!
